intro: Senecio uhligii, commonly known as the Uhlig's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Senecio uhligii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
